questions.question: What is Lalace Ivy's middle name?
In which month is our anniversary?
What is Lalace Ivy's birth month?
In which city was Kenneth born?
In which city was Lalace Ivy born?
What year did their relationship start?

wrongMessages.msg: Is that your final answer? Because it's not the right one! ğŸ˜‰
My circuits are telling me that's incorrect. Try again!
You're just guessing now, aren't you? Try again!
That was a good try! But not good enough. Another go?
I've seen better answers from a fortune cookie. Care to try again?
Hmm, I'll have to get back to you on that... just kidding, it's wrong!
Oops! Looks like someone needs to study their relationship facts a bit more. ğŸ˜‰
Incorrect! Even I know that one, and I'm just code. Try again!
My database is showing a different answer. Are you sure you're not making this up? ğŸ¤”
Wrong answer! But hey, at least you tried... right?
That's a negative, Ghostrider. Next question?
Error 404: Correct Answer Not Found. Please try again.
Close, but no cigar! Or maybe not even close. Who knows? Not you, apparently!
Let's pretend that didn't happen and you try again, shall we?
That's... an interesting answer. Not the right one, but interesting.
My cat could have guessed better. And I don't have a cat.
Are you from an alternate universe where that's the right answer?
Did you just Google that? Because Google would have been right.
If answers were stars, that one wouldn't even be a black hole.
I'm programmed for facts, and that, my friend, is a work of fiction.
That answer has been officially cancelled. Try another one.
I think you're confusing our story with a different one. Try again!
Not quite. But I admire your confidence!
That answer is on vacation. And it's not coming back.
I'm sending that answer back to the factory. It's clearly defective.
Even my loading animation knows that's not right.
Let's file that under 'Creative Attempts'. Next?
That's a bold strategy, Cotton. Let's see if it pays off. (It didn't).
I'm not a mind reader, but I know that's not what I was thinking.
The council of elders (me) has deemed that answer... unworthy.
If this were a test, you'd get extra credit for creativity, but zero points for correctness.
That answer just isn't it, chief. Try again.
I'm going to give you a 'no' on that one, dawg.
You're playing checkers while I'm playing chess. That's not the right move.
I've seen more accurate predictions in a horoscope.
That answer has been yeeted into the void. Please provide another.
I'm afraid that's not the password to unlock the details.
You're warming up, I can feel it! (Just kidding, you're ice cold).
That's what we call a 'happy little accident'. A very, very wrong accident.
I'd phone a friend if I were you. This isn't working out.
The truth is out there... and it's nowhere near your answer.
I'm sorry, the number you have dialed is not a correct answer.
That answer is a bit... spicy. And also wrong.
You're going to have to try at least 10% harder than that.
I'm not saying it was a bad answer, but I am thinking it loudly.
That's a swing and a miss! Batter up for another try.
I'm afraid your subscription to 'Correct Answers' has expired.
That answer is currently out of office. Please leave a message (or a better answer).
I'm starting to think you're doing this on purpose.
That answer has been fact-checked and found to be... hilarious.
You're on a roll! A downhill roll, but a roll nonetheless.

cancelMessages.msg: Quitting so soon? I knew you couldn't handle it!
Aww, is it too hard? Don't worry, we can't all be geniuses.
Fine, run away! The details will remain a secret forever... or until you try again.
Giving up already? I'm not mad, just disappointed.
And they say 'winners never quit'. Guess we know which one you are!
Okay, okay, you win... at quitting. Congrats?
The secret details are safe for another day. Thanks to you.
Was it something I said? Oh wait, it was the question. My bad.
You've activated my trap card: Guilt Trip! It's super effective.
Don't worry, participation trophies are on the way.
I'll just tell everyone you got it right. Our little secret.
This is your brain on 'I give up'. Any questions?
You miss 100% of the shots you don't take... and also the ones you quit on.
Fine, be that way. I didn't want to show you the cool stuff anyway.
Is this your first time playing a game? It's cute.
Come back when you've had your coffee. You'll need it.
I'm starting to think you don't actually want to see the details.
And the award for 'Most Likely to Give Up' goes to... you!
That's one way to solve a problem: run away from it.
I'll just put these secrets back in the vault then. Locked up tight.
You were so close! (You weren't, but I'm trying to be nice).
Okay, but don't come crying to me when you forget the anniversary.
The escape button was a valid choice. A cowardly choice, but valid.
I'm telling Kenneth/Lalace Ivy you gave up this easily.
You have chosen... the path of least resistance. Bold move.
This action has been recorded and will be used against you in a future argument.
I guess some secrets are meant to be kept. For now.
If at first you don't succeed... give up and click cancel, I guess.
The details are now 100% more secret, thanks to your lack of effort.
You're breaking my little digital heart. And my code.
I had so much faith in you. For about 5 seconds.
It's okay, not everyone can be a hero. Some are just... quitters.
Don't quit your day job to become a detective, that's for sure.
I'm not saying I'm disappointed, but I've hidden the confetti.
You've successfully failed. Is that an achievement?
This is why we can't have nice things... like unlocked details.
On a scale of 1 to 10, your effort was a solid 'Cancel'.
I'm adding 'easily gives up' to your relationship profile.
The details are now guarded by a dragon. You'll never get them.
You've chosen the 'mystery' route. How romantic... and lazy.
I'm not judging you, but my code is.
You could have been a legend. Instead, you're a 'Cancel' button enthusiast.
I'm going to need a moment to process this level of surrender.
The 'Cancel' button: for when trying is just too much effort.
You've left the chat. And the game. And my respect.
I'm sure you had your reasons. Probably not very good ones, but reasons.
This is fine. Everything is fine. The secrets are fine. I'm fine.
You've unlocked the 'Quitter' achievement! It comes with a sense of shame.
I'll just be here, guarding the secrets. Don't mind me.
You're free to go. But the details aren't.
I'm starting a support group for abandoned Q&A games. You're the first member.
